definition[0]: used to say what is supposed to be true in a particular situation, especially when the opposite is true
example[0]: Theoretically, Damianâ€™s the boss, but I coordinate the team on a day-to-day basis.
definition[1]: according to a scientific idea that has not been proven to be true in a practical way
example[1]: It is theoretically possible for computers to be programmed to think like humans.
